metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19647 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
radare2 through 4.0.0 lacks validation of the content variable in the function r_asm_pseudo_incbin at libr/asm/asm.c, ultimately leading to an arbitrary write. This allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted input.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-4.2.1 - 4.2.1+dfsg-1
libradare2-common - 4.2.1+dfsg-1
radare2 - 4.2.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1+dfsg-1').
